function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Shifting political divide in addressing the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid changes in people’s behavior and attitudes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the impact of political views on compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to authority and measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Political orientation not a predictor of compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with social distancing measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unemployment leading to economic and social consequences","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Backlash against authorities leading to resistance to compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of social norm on compliance behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in compliance due to practical limitations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential decline in compliant behavior over time","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Short-term compliance due to low impact of costs and negative emotions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Individual differences in compliance based on impulsiveness","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in achieving minimum certainty of punishment for violating covid-19 measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mixed results in the relationship between moral support for measures and compliant behavior","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perception of personal costs not influencing compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative emotions increasing compliance with stay-at-home measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relatively high self-reported compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large reductions in retail and recreational activities, as well as in the usage of public transit, and visits to workplaces","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People meeting with friends and relatives outside of their direct household","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in covid-19 measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-normative obligation to obey the law","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Political orientation not associated with compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Close contact with multiple individuals during data collection or analysis may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conducting in-person surveys or interviews for data collection may pose a risk of exposure to contagious diseases for both data collectors and participants.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing and handling physical documents or materials during the research process may create opportunities for the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement error in survey questions or responses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential bias in survey responses","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Participants may have low compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived clarity of covid-19 measures may be low, leading to confusion and potential non-adherence to the guidelines.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants may have opportunities to violate covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor correlation of one item in relation to the others may affect the overall accuracy of the findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of an item due to low cronbach’s alpha may result in a loss of valuable insights or aspects of the phenomenon under study.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Measurement of negative impact and emotions related to covid-19 measures may lead to psychological distress for participants.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of 25 participants providing professional care for covid-19 patients increases the risk of bias in the final sample.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of 7 participants who failed the attention check may lead to a biased final sample.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collection of personal data such as age, gender, education, and health status increases the risk of privacy breaches.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential influence of political orientation on compliance with pandemic measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Echo chambers reinforcing particular political orientations and influencing views on pandemic measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of fear of authorities on compliance with pandemic measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for non-compliance with rules and requests","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher impulsivity predicting non-compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of social norms on compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative emotions leading to lower compliance with quarantine measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear rules leading to lower compliance with quarantine measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived capacity and knowledge affecting compliance with quarantine measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Concordance between self-report and objective compliance measures differs based on the method of assessment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in compliance may be influenced by substantive moral support for measures and perception of costs and strain","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with stay at home and social distancing measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of moral appeals for compliance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
